ImDrawFlags_.comment: // PathStroke(), AddPolyline(): specify that shape should be closed (Important: this is always == 1 for legacy reason)
ImDrawFlags_.name: ImDrawFlags_Closed

ImDrawFlags_.comment: // AddRect(), AddRectFilled(), PathRect(): enable rounding top-left corner only (when rounding > 0.0f, we default to all corners). Was 0x01.
ImDrawFlags_.name: ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersTopLeft

ImDrawFlags_.comment: // AddRect(), AddRectFilled(), PathRect(): enable rounding top-right corner only (when rounding > 0.0f, we default to all corners). Was 0x02.
ImDrawFlags_.name: ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersTopRight

ImDrawFlags_.comment: // AddRect(), AddRectFilled(), PathRect(): enable rounding bottom-left corner only (when rounding > 0.0f, we default to all corners). Was 0x04.
ImDrawFlags_.name: ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersBottomLeft

ImDrawFlags_.comment: // AddRect(), AddRectFilled(), PathRect(): enable rounding bottom-right corner only (when rounding > 0.0f, we default to all corners). Wax 0x08.
ImDrawFlags_.name: ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersBottomRight

ImDrawFlags_.comment: // AddRect(), AddRectFilled(), PathRect(): disable rounding on all corners (when rounding > 0.0f). This is NOT zero, NOT an implicit flag!
ImDrawFlags_.name: ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersNone

ImDrawFlags_.comment: // Default to ALL corners if none of the _RoundCornersXX flags are specified.
ImDrawFlags_.name: ImDrawFlags_RoundCornersDefault_

ImDrawListFlags_.comment: // Enable anti-aliased lines/borders (*2 the number of triangles for 1.0f wide line or lines thin enough to be drawn using textures, otherwise *3 the number of triangles)
ImDrawListFlags_.name: ImDrawListFlags_AntiAliasedLines

ImDrawListFlags_.comment: // Enable anti-aliased lines/borders using textures when possible. Require backend to render with bilinear filtering (NOT point/nearest filtering).
ImDrawListFlags_.name: ImDrawListFlags_AntiAliasedLinesUseTex

ImDrawListFlags_.comment: // Enable anti-aliased edge around filled shapes (rounded rectangles, circles).
ImDrawListFlags_.name: ImDrawListFlags_AntiAliasedFill

ImDrawListFlags_.comment: // Can emit 'VtxOffset > 0' to allow large meshes. Set when 'ImGuiBackendFlags_RendererHasVtxOffset' is enabled.
ImDrawListFlags_.name: ImDrawListFlags_AllowVtxOffset

ImFontAtlasFlags_.comment: // Don't round the height to next power of two
ImFontAtlasFlags_.name: ImFontAtlasFlags_NoPowerOfTwoHeight

ImFontAtlasFlags_.comment: // Don't build software mouse cursors into the atlas (save a little texture memory)
ImFontAtlasFlags_.name: ImFontAtlasFlags_NoMouseCursors

ImFontAtlasFlags_.comment: // Don't build thick line textures into the atlas (save a little texture memory, allow support for point/nearest filtering). The AntiAliasedLinesUseTex features uses them, otherwise they will be rendered using polygons (more expensive for CPU/GPU).
ImFontAtlasFlags_.name: ImFontAtlasFlags_NoBakedLines

ImFontFlags_.comment: // Disable throwing an error/assert when calling AddFontXXX() with missing file/data. Calling code is expected to check AddFontXXX() return value.
ImFontFlags_.name: ImFontFlags_NoLoadError

ImFontFlags_.comment: // [Internal] Disable loading new baked sizes, disable garbage collecting current ones. e.g. if you want to lock a font to a single size. Important: if you use this to preload given sizes, consider the possibility of multiple font density used on Retina display.
ImFontFlags_.name: ImFontFlags_LockBakedSizes

ImGuiBackendFlags_.name: ImGuiBackendFlags_HasMouseCursors

IF POSSIBLE, ignore viewports with the ImGuiViewportFlags_NoInputs flag (Win32 backend, GLFW 3.30+ backend can do this, SDL backend cannot). If this cannot be done, Dear ImGui needs to use a flawed heuristic to find the viewport under.

ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_.name: ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_NoSelectAll

ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_.name: ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_NoRangeSelect

ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_.comment: // Disable selecting items when navigating (useful for e.g. supporting range-select in a list of checkboxes).
ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_.name: ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_NoAutoSelect

ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_.name: ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_BoxSelect1d

ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_.comment: // Enable box-selection with varying width or varying x pos items support (e.g. different width labels, or 2D layout/grid). This is slower: alters clipping logic so that e.g. horizontal movements will update selection of normally clipped items.
ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_.name: ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_BoxSelect2d

ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_.comment: // Disable scrolling when box-selecting near edges of scope.
ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_.name: ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_BoxSelectNoScroll

ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_.comment: // Clear selection when clicking on empty location within scope.

ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_.name: ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_ScopeWindow

ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_.name: ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_ScopeRect

ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_.comment: // Apply selection on mouse down when clicking on unselected item. (Default)

ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_.comment: // Apply selection on mouse release when clicking an unselected item. Allow dragging an unselected item without altering selection.
ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_.name: ImGuiMultiSelectFlags_SelectOnClickRelease

ImGuiNavMoveFlags_.comment: // On failed request, restart from opposite side

ImGuiNavMoveFlags_.name: ImGuiNavMoveFlags_DebugNoResult

ImGuiNavMoveFlags_.name: ImGuiNavMoveFlags_FocusApi

ImGuiNavMoveFlags_.comment: // == Focus + Activate if item is Inputable + DontChangeNavHighlight
ImGuiNavMoveFlags_.name: ImGuiNavMoveFlags_IsTabbing

ImGuiNavMoveFlags_.name: ImGuiNavMoveFlags_NoSelect

ImGuiOldColumnFlags_.comment: // Disable resizing columns when clicking on the dividers

ImGuiPopupFlags_.comment: // For BeginPopupContext*(): open on Left Mouse release. Guaranteed to always be == 0 (same as ImGuiMouseButton_Left)

ImGuiPopupFlags_.name: ImGuiPopupFlags_NoOpenOverItems

ImGuiPopupFlags_.name: ImGuiPopupFlags_AnyPopupId

ImGuiPopupFlags_.name: ImGuiPopupFlags_AnyPopupLevel

ImGuiScrollFlags_.comment: // If item is not visible: scroll as little as possible on X axis to bring item back into view [default for X axis]
ImGuiScrollFlags_.name: ImGuiScrollFlags_KeepVisibleEdgeX

ImGuiScrollFlags_.comment: // If item is not visible: scroll as little as possible on Y axis to bring item back into view [default for Y axis for windows that are already visible]

ImGuiScrollFlags_.comment: // If item is not visible: scroll to make the item centered on Y axis

ImGuiScrollFlags_.name: ImGuiScrollFlags_AlwaysCenterY

ImGuiScrollFlags_.name: ImGuiScrollFlags_NoScrollParent

ImGuiSelectableFlagsPrivate_.name: ImGuiSelectableFlags_SelectOnNav

ImGuiSelectableFlagsPrivate_.name: ImGuiSelectableFlags_NoPadWithHalfSpacing

ImGuiSelectableFlags_.comment: // Clicking this doesn't close parent popup window (overrides ImGuiItemFlags_AutoClosePopups)
ImGuiSelectableFlags_.name: ImGuiSelectableFlags_NoAutoClosePopups

ImGuiSelectableFlags_.name: ImGuiSelectableFlags_SpanAllColumns

ImGuiSelectableFlags_.comment: // Cannot be selected, display grayed out text

ImGuiSeparatorFlags_.comment: // Axis default to current layout type, so generally Horizontal unless e.g. in a menu bar

ImGuiSliderFlags_.name: ImGuiSliderFlags_Logarithmic

ImGuiSliderFlags_.name: ImGuiSliderFlags_NoRoundToFormat

ImGuiSliderFlags_.name: ImGuiSliderFlags_NoInput

ImGuiTabItemFlags_.name: ImGuiTabItemFlags_NoCloseWithMiddleMouseButton

ImGuiTabItemFlags_.comment: // Disable tooltip for the given tab

ImGuiTreeNodeFlags_.comment: // Draw as selected

Will fix once we add support for "no main viewport".

ImGuiWindowFlags_.comment: // Disable title-bar

ImGuiWindowFlags_.comment: // Disable user resizing with the lower-right grip

ImGuiWindowFlags_.comment: // Resize every window to its content every frame

ImGuiWindowFlags_.comment: // Disable catching mouse, hovering test with pass through.

ImGuiWindowFlags_.comment: // Has a menu-bar

ImGuiWindowFlags_.comment: // Disable taking focus when transitioning from hidden to visible state

ImGuiWindowFlags_.comment: // Disable bringing window to front when taking focus (e.g. clicking on it or programmatically giving it focus)

ImGuiWindowFlags_.comment: // Always show horizontal scrollbar (even if ContentSize.x < Size.x)

ImGuiWindowFlags_.comment: // No keyboard/gamepad navigation within the window

ImGuiWindowFlags_.comment: // No focusing toward this window with keyboard/gamepad navigation (e.g. skipped by CTRL+TAB)

When used in a tab/docking context, tab is selected when clicking the X + closure is not assumed (will wait for user to stop submitting the tab). Otherwise closure is assumed when pressing the X, so if you keep submitting the tab may reappear at end of tab bar.

ImGuiWindowFlags_.comment: // Disable docking of this window

ImGuiWindowFlags_.comment: // Don't use! For internal use by BeginPopupModal()
ImGuiWindowFlags_.name: ImGuiWindowFlags_Modal

ImGuiWindowFlags_.comment: // Don't use! For internal use by BeginMenu()

comment.sameline: // 4*4  // Clipping rectangle (x1, y1, x2, y2). Subtract ImDrawData->DisplayPos to get clipping rectangle in "viewport" coordinates
// 16   // Reference to a font/texture atlas (where backend called ImTextureData::SetTexID()) or to a user-provided texture ID (via e.g. ImGui::Image() calls). Both will lead to a ImTextureID value.
// 4    // Start offset in vertex buffer. ImGuiBackendFlags_RendererHasVtxOffset: always 0, otherwise may be >0 to support meshes larger than 64K vertices with 16-bit indices.
// 4    // Start offset in index buffer.
// 4    // Number of indices (multiple of 3) to be rendered as triangles. Vertices are stored in the callee ImDrawList's vtx_buffer[] array, indices in idx_buffer[].
// 4-8  // If != NULL, call the function instead of rendering the vertices. clip_rect and texture_id will be set normally.

// 4-8  // Callback user data (when UserCallback != NULL). If called AddCallback() with size == 0, this is a copy of the AddCallback() argument. If called AddCallback() with size > 0, this is pointing to a buffer where data is stored.
// 4 // Size of callback user data when using storage, otherwise 0.
// 4 // [Internal] Offset of callback user data when using storage, otherwise -1.
// Only valid after Render() is called and before the next NewFrame() is called.
// Number of ImDrawList* to render. (== CmdLists.Size). Exists for legacy reason.
// For convenience, sum of all ImDrawList's IdxBuffer.Size
// For convenience, sum of all ImDrawList's VtxBuffer.Size
// Array of ImDrawList* to render. The ImDrawLists are owned by ImGuiContext and only pointed to from here.

// Top-left position of the viewport to render (== top-left of the orthogonal projection matrix to use) (== GetMainViewport()->Pos for the main viewport, == (0.0) in most single-viewport applications)
// Size of the viewport to render (== GetMainViewport()->Size for the main viewport, == io.DisplaySize in most single-viewport applications)

// Amount of pixels for each unit of DisplaySize. Copied from viewport->FramebufferScale (== io.DisplayFramebufferScale for main viewport). Generally (1,1) on normal display, (2,2) on OSX with Retina display.
// Viewport carrying the ImDrawData instance, might be of use to the renderer (generally not).

// List of textures to update. Most of the times the list is shared by all ImDrawData, has only 1 texture and it doesn't need any update. This almost always points to ImGui::GetPlatformIO().Textures[]. May be overriden or set to NULL if you want to manually update textures.
// Pointers to global layers for: regular, tooltip. LayersP[0] is owned by DrawData.
